column4: I've downloaded the dapper democracyTV packages from the site. But they tell me that I have unmet dependencies ...
Package mozilla-psm is not installed.
Package mozilla-dev is not installed.
I can't find those packages ...
why would the dapper .debs still have unmet dependencies like that ?
Also, my dapper upgrade came with no xchat ...
Noone has any ideas on the mozilla-dev and mozilla-psm dependencies then ? Has anyone installed democracy TV ?
How typicallly Linux ... :-(
how so?
well the dapper debs have unmet dependencies that aren't in the repos. Installing anything on Linux that's not in the repos is usually a major pain in the ass ... IMO
well I haven't had the need to isntall things that are not in the repos... but some stuff . like Eclipse SDK is better from outside thant the version in the repos
that's the whole point of a distro...
in windows. you have a lot of installers doing things their way .. an fiddleing around with the windows registry
have you ever tried unsitalling NORTO ANTIVIRUS...
your machine becomes turtle slow after a couple of installs
i'll gie yo a link
installed system
Ok I'll check out the wiki thanks ...
there is a reason for the repos.. let me send a link.....
packaging is key http://www.markshuttleworth.com/archives/66    <----- Mr Shuttleworth
just a question... whay are you chasing dependencies for an hour?
??? because I'm trying to install some software ...
lie?
like waht?
